answers.answer: Congratulations on your pink bundle!!Enjoy
How come I can not get to the site? Is it a certain type of pc I have tried other ones too?Tried tresmathews too.Any suggestions
Awwwww Kristen she is adorable. I am glad she is doing well. I can't beleive that you had her already. Time is flying. I can't wait to meet my little one.
congratulations!
Congratulations! She is beautiful. So wide awake for just being born.
She is beautiful!!!!!  I'm so glad you are ok.  Take it easy and enjoy being a mommy!

Congrats she is beautiful. Hope all is well.For anyone who is having trouble seeing the pic. highlight the web address by right clicking and going over address, right click again and go to a search engine that is available on the menu. It will then take you to the address link and click on it.Samantha

Everyone, thanks! I'm so thrilled to have my little girl at home! She is sooooo cute! The hospital photo just does not do he justice!cinnamonheart, try going to www.altru.org, then there is a tab at the top that says nursery. Then under the girl list you will find Hannah with parents, Kristen and Michael.Hannah is asleep in Daddy's arms so I have a few more minutes to tell you all about what happened. If you remember, I was on bedrest for preeclampsia since March 18th. April 5th, I was going to have an Amniocentesis to test baby's lung maturity, but my BP was high, and my Dr. decided to cancel the Amnio and do a C-section that day. The reason we had a C-section instead of an induction was the baby's presentation was breech. The section went great! I thought the whole experience was amazing. DH watched the entire procedure, he was such a trooper! After Hannah was born, I was put on Magnesium Sulfate for 24 hours due to my BP being high. I had to stay on bedrest for 2 more days. Which was hard. DH changed all baby's diapers and helped me to breastfeed. I was so impressed by his level of involvement. Hannah was born at 34 weeks gestation and she is perfect! She did not need to spend any time in the NICU, and she was able, to room in with DH and I. She is breasfeeding beautifully and rarely even cries. She is such a good baby! I never understood how much I could love another person until I had her. I'm so emotional and happy, I cry so easily. DH and I have waited so long for this day to arrive. Thank you everyone for all your support through my having a miscarriage, then struggling with infertility, and then worrying constantly about this pregnancy. I just want everyone to know who is having troube getting pregnant, if I can do this, so can you!!I am still on some BP meds because I am continueing to have high pressures. Hopefully things will get better and I can taper them off in the next few weeks. I feel good, my incision barely hurts anymore. Hannah has her first Dr appt with tomorrow, and I have one on Weds. We'll keep you updated on our progress and hopefully I will be able to stay caught up on what is going on with everyone now that I have this little bundle to love!

She is soooooooooooo cute.  Thanks for sharing the pic.  Congratulations.  I am so glad all went well for you.   Enjoy her because it goes quick.  You'll be posting on here before you know it asking how to plan her graduation party  LOL!!!!!!!  Take Care and get lots of rest.
she is beautiful. Enjoy her to peices, because before you know it she will be like mine. LOL. congrats.

We are trying to decide what color her hair is. It seems to look like a different color depending on the lighting in the room and what she is wearing. I have red curly hair, and I've been hoping she would have red hair like me. I have this vision in my mind of a little mini me running around with red hair and freckles. It will be interesting to see in the next few months or years how she changes. I can't wait! But at the same time I want her to stay little too. She is a about 5 lbs now and is just a little dolly. She is so little!!! Her preemie clothes are super cute on her!
Thanks so much for your story. I will be induced around 36 weeks ( in 1 week!!!) for high blood pressure. Your story has given me hope and has made me sooooooo excited. Congrats!!!!
She is adorable. Enjoy every minute of her being little, they grow and change so fast.Congrats to you and your family.Mandy
It worked It worked I got to see!!So sweet, Yes big bright eyes!!I read your birth story and cried--I want a new one!!(mines 5 months old)Yes when hubbies get right down to it they can be wonderful!!
Loovvee seeing those pics but it makes me want to have mine RIGHT NOW.  She is gorgeous, congratulations!!!!

Just wanted to say your little girl is so beautiful and precious. My little girl is already a month old today,Time seems to go so fast once they are home with you. CONGRATUKATIONS ENJOY EVERY MOMENT:)
OMG she is so beautiful!!  Does she have reddish hair??  I'm so happy for you!!
CONGRATULATIONS SHE IS GORGEOUS!!!I bet you are enjoying every minute of her!We still have no Gonza so fingers crossed!
AWWWWWW...she is adorable !! congrats to you and your family !!
Congratulations! What a pretty name!

question: After 3 weeks in the hospital (2 of them on bedrest!) I'm finally home and so happy to get a few minutes to send some photos (Hannah is sleeping)! We are so thrilled to have our little Hannah home and Daddy is happy to have us both home.  Here she is!Hannah KayApril 05, 20051:36 PM5lbs. 8.7ozs.19 1/2 inchesDr. AndersonThe link to her hospital photo just a few mintues after she arrived is:http://www.altrunursery.org/babygirl.cfm?key=4327I ended up have the baby by C-section at 34 weeks due to my Preeclampsia and the baby's breech presentation, baby did awesome for being a little early. She did not need any time in the NICU, she is perfect!She is waking up so I gotta go! Hope everyone is doing well!
title: Hannah Kay has arrived!
